metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3865 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
[ksmbd: fix out-of-bound read in smb2_write] Laurence Wit discovered that the KSMBD implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate a buffer size in certain situations, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-86-generic - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-5.15.0-86-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-86-generic - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-86-generic-64k - 5.15.0-86.96
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-86.96').
